content.description: Sit-start the left-side of the brittle-looking overhang facing the stream on a pair of edges. Make a few hard moves up the overhang on some thin holds, before venturing up the slab on some questionable rock.
content.protection: 3 or 6 pads. Landing is good, boulder is tall, holds eventually break?
content.location: This problem is found on the downhill overhanging face of the boulder. This overhang is found right to the scoop feature.

content.description: Sit-start the large sidepull feature. Go up to a jug in the middle of the overhang before hucking for the apex and holding a massive swing. Classic.
content.location: When approaching this boulder from above, this boulder problem will be found on the far right-side of the boulder. This is the first problem you will see when approaching this boulder from downstream.

content.description: This is a massive boulder found next to the seasonal stream. Slightly higher on the hillside there is another large boulder known as the "Hangman Boulder".   This area tends to stay pretty humid and moist, especially during leaf-season. The gully is protected from the wind, and the canopy extinguishes the sunlight quickly.   Fall Season and Spring Season are the best times to visit this boulder, when the air is more dry and there are less mosquitoes.
